content.description: Start with a hang start with feet on small rock under the first ledge. Cross left hand to small crimp swing out to grab a crimp on the other side of the ledge with right hand. While hanging throw a heel hook with right foot while flagging with left. Crank up and grab the point of the second ledge. Step up and top out.
content.protection: Small problem but if you have a crash pad bring it!
content.location: Past the dam and past the two small houses up on a hill.

content.description: Problem starts with a hanging start with feet on the inside of the boulder. Throw a wide right foot to a ledge on the boulder next to where you are hanging then throw a right hand up on the second boulder to a crimp. Right after the throw, bump your right hand to  a share outcrop. Then bring left foot to where your left hand is and then cross left hand over right. Bring right foot up still staying wide and smear up wall then pull up and top out.
content.protection: Its a shorter problem if you have a crash pad bring it!
content.location: Past the dam and the two houses. On the hill above the second house.

content.description: This problem starts with two feet on a smaller rock and two hands low on the first part of the boulder. Cross with your right hand further up on the same part you started on and then match hands. Throw a heel hook with your left foot to the edge. Put your right foot up onto the second part of the boulder and push up to grab with your right hand to the top part of the second part of the boulder and match hands. Then work your way up to the top using the edge of the boulder for feet. Top out.
content.protection: Not a bad fall if you don't have a crash pad. But if you do bring one.
content.location: Up on the hill past the little house near the damn/waterfall.

content.description: This problem is found on the main boulder on the right side. The side resembles a heart. It is a simple crack problem. Its a short crack climb that starts with right foot out on a small rock in the ground and then a wide left foot on the base of the main boulder. Start with hands in the crack then cross hands up further on the crack and then bring right foot over to left foot and back flag the left. Move up the crack crossing hands and then pull up on top of boulder to top out.
content.protection: The boulder isn't too big but if you have a crash pad bring it.
content.location: The boulder is up a hill very close to the little house right after the parking lot near the bridge and dam/waterfall. The problem is on the right of the boulder and is on the part where it resembles a heart.

content.description: Boulders found right inside Ridley Creek State park. The boulders are close to each other and all feature smaller problems.
